abstract: AIMS Financial Group chairman George Wang is still intent on attracting Chinese companies to Asia Pacific Stock Exchange in Sydney, which AIMS acquired in 2008; remains undeterred by turmoil in Chinese markets, believing that his exchange can still provide bridge between Chinese industry and Australian capital; China's freezing of initial public offerings has emerged as obstacle, in addition to fact that Chinese and Australian regulators have yet to approve plan.
lead_paragraph: The Asia Pacific Stock Exchange has just two listings now, but its owner, George Wang, has ambitions to to link capital-hungry Chinese companies with Australian investors.

headline.main: An Exchange in Australia Woos Listings From China
headline.print_headline: An Exchange in Australia Woos Listings From China

snippet: The Asia Pacific Stock Exchange has just two listings now, but its owner, George Wang, has ambitions to to link capital-hungry Chinese companies with Australian investors.
